description: From Middle English *gostles, from Old English gāstlēas (“lifeless, dead”), equivalent to ghost +‎ -less. Cognate with Dutch geestloos, German geistlos.

entries.meaning: Without spirit, soul, or life; dead.

examples: I don't know about Gary, but I dreamed about dark, spooky houses and horrible, groaning ghosts all night. I was glad to wake up and find it was a bright, sunny, ghostless morning.
